content: Is anyone familiar with the state of academic category theory in Japan? Are there any professors or grad students there who are working in category theory, type theory, homotopy theory, etc.?
I know there are theoretical computer scientists who use category theory in their work in Japan, such as Makoto Hamana and Shin-ya Katsumata.
For what I know, Hasuo Ichiro's group also uses applied category theory (among other things). They mainly focus on systems design. https://group-mmm.org/index.html

Personally I know Hassei http://www.kurims.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~hassei and Masaru Shirahata https://www.sci.keio.ac.jp/en/people/5807/ and Atsushi Igarashi https://www.fos.kuis.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~igarashi/index.html.en and Naoki Kobayashi https://www-kb.is.s.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~koba/.
there's plenty of excellent type theory in Japan, as you can see e.g. in the conference series APLAS https://conf.researchr.org/home/aplas-2022
Yuki Maehara is also working on infinity categories as a postdoc in Japan. https://yukimaehara.github.io

Hi! I'm a postdoc in Japan, working at kyoto university with Hassei. (https://sites.google.com/view/jspl-personal-webpage/) I do wide range of category theory, mostly differential categories, but also linear logic, quantum, commutative algebra, some theoretical science etc.
At kyoto; Hassei also has a large group of students doing a variety of (higher) category theory with various applications in theoretical computer science
I'm in Tokyo and interested in applied category theory (including applications to thermodynamics). Haven't published much yet though, apart from this conference paper on Bayesian agents.
I'm not in academia anymore but I live/work in Tokyo.
